citeinfo.title: Montana Schools, 2004
citeinfo.othercit: The former name of the data set on the NRIS web site was "school2004"

descript.abstract:
The Montana Schools Database is comprised of public and private schools within the state of Montana. This includes colleges and universities.
The overall source for the school information came from the Directory of Montana Schools 2003-2004, published by the Montana Office of Public Instruction (OPI). FEMA HAZUS data was used for school attributes. The U.S. Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) was used for positional data. The FEMA data source is derived from the National Center for Education Statistics with address range geocoding applied to derive positions. Other miscellaneous sources included the internet: whitepages.com, yellowpages.com, privatebug.org, myaasite.com/programs/schools/county, and greatschools.net/modperl/bycity/mt.
The layer was modified in 2015 to change the values in the Name and Address fields from all upper case to upper and lower case. Several time-sensitive fields with contact information for the school administrator were removed.

idinfo.useconst: The Montana State Library provides this product/service for informational purposes only. The Library did not produce it for, nor is it suitable for legal, engineering, or surveying purposes. Consumers of this information should review or consult the primary data and information sources to ascertain the viability of the information for their purposes. The Library provides these data in good faith but does not represent or warrant its accuracy, adequacy, or completeness. In no event shall the Library be liable for any incorrect results or analysis; any direct, indirect, special, or consequential damages to any party; or any lost profits arising out of or in connection with the use or the inability to use the data or the services provided. The Library makes these data and services available as a convenience to the public, and for no other purpose. The Library reserves the right to change or revise published data and/or services at any time.
idinfo.datacred: Creation of this data was made possible through funding from the Montana Homeland Security Taskforce GIS Subcommittee. The database was created by the Montana Base Map Service Center with assistance from the Montana USGS Mapping Partnership Office in Bozeman. Certain existing data from the GNIS and Hazus databases were used to intially populate the database

attracc.attraccr: Attributes were primarily compiled from phone calls, websites, HAZUS, or existing tabular data from the Office of Public Instruction and can be assumed accurate within the bounds of those sources. Attributes such as contact names and phone numbers will change and will require maintenance

qattracc.attracce: The attribute accuracy has not undergone any statistical tests

horizpa.horizpar: untested - points have been moved from original GNIS locations to those of existing aerial imagery if they could be identified

citeinfo.origin: MT. Dept. of Revenue, Office of Public Instructions
citeinfo.title: Directory of Montana Schools, 2003-2004

srcinfo.srccontr: This was used to populate attribute items
GNIS points were used as initial locations for schools
FEMA HAZUS data was also used to populate some attributes - see abstract
In certain cases like Yellowstone County, GIS datasets were used to confirm or relocate the spatial positions in GNIS

procstep.procdesc: The overall source for the school information came from the Directory of Montana Schools 2003-2004, published by the Montana Office of Public Instruction. FEMA HAZUS data was used for school attributes. The U.S. Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) was used for positional data. The FEMA data source is derived from the National Center for Education Statistics with address range geocoding applied to derive positions. Other miscellaneous sources included the internet: whitepages.com, yellowpages.com, privatebug.org, myaasite.com/programs/schools/county, and greatschools.net/modperl/bycity/mt. Locations of the schools were moved from the original GNIS locations to identifiable locations on digital orthorectified images, or when that wasn't feasible moved into identifiable parcels from the Montana Cadastral Database. Further spatial adjustment will take place as high resolution imagery is available
The location of Edgerton School near Kalispell was moved after it was discovered to be incorrect.

edom.edomvd: School that only have some or all of grades level K-6

School that only have some or all of grades level 6-9
School with multiple K-12 grade levels.

state in which school is located
